# Create AFD-rule-set

This module creates Azure Front Door Rule Sets.

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD033 -->
## Requirements

The following requirements are needed by this module:

- <a name="requirement_terraform"></a> [terraform](#requirement\_terraform) (~> 1.10)

- <a name="requirement_azapi"></a> [azapi](#requirement\_azapi) (~> 2.4)

## Resources

The following resources are used by this module:

- [azapi_resource.rule_set](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/Azure/azapi/latest/docs/resources/resource) (resource)

<!-- markdownlint-disable MD013 -->
## Required Inputs

The following input variables are required:

### <a name="input_name"></a> [name](#input\_name)

Description: The name of the rule set.

Type: `string`

### <a name="input_profile_id"></a> [profile\_id](#input\_profile\_id)

Description: The resource ID of the CDN profile.

Type: `string`

## Optional Inputs

The following input variables are optional (have default values):

### <a name="input_rules"></a> [rules](#input\_rules)

Description: A map of rules to apply to the rule set. Each rule contains conditions and actions.

Type:

```hcl
map(object({
    name                      = string
    order                     = number
    actions                   = optional(list(map(any)), [])
    conditions                = optional(list(map(any)), [])
    match_processing_behavior = optional(string, "Continue")
  }))
```

Default: `{}`

## Outputs

The following outputs are exported:

### <a name="output_id"></a> [id](#output\_id)

Description: The ID of the rule set.

### <a name="output_name"></a> [name](#output\_name)

Description: The name of the rule set.

### <a name="output_resource_id"></a> [resource\_id](#output\_resource\_id)

Description: The Azure Resource ID of the rule set.

### <a name="output_rule_ids"></a> [rule\_ids](#output\_rule\_ids)

Description: Map of rule names to their resource IDs.

### <a name="output_rules"></a> [rules](#output\_rules)

Description: Map of rule names to their module outputs.

## Modules

The following Modules are called:

### <a name="module_rule"></a> [rule](#module\_rule)

Source: ../rule-set-rule

Version:
